Detailed Description

Implementation of cvq. It stores everything on filesystem (in directory conf_vq/domains/).

Definition at line 49 of file cfsvq.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum cvq::auth_info_flags [inherited]
 

possible user account flags

Enumeration values:
pop3_blk  blocked pop3 access
smtp_blk  blocked smtp access
admin  admin (it was first added user)
ftp_blk  ftp access blocked
ignore  ignore me (entry MUST be ignored)
supadm  super (server) admin

maildir  maildir
sms  sms notification
autoresp  autorespond

uint8_t cfsvq::virt_rm (  const std::string &  ali  )  [protected]
 

Remove alias from virtualdomains. It does not check whether it's a domain (if you want to remove only aliases you need to first use assign_ex to check whether alias is in users/assign, if it is it means it's not an alias).
